intro: Dalenia glabra var. kinabaluensis, commonly known as the Bornean smooth dalenia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheat. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories at high elevations. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
